Design and develop scalable integrations between Coursera and external LMS/LXP platforms, ensuring seamless interoperability and great learner/administrator experiences.
Implement LTI-compliant integrations to allow partners to use external tools (e.g., grading systems, coding IDEs) within Coursera, extending platform functionality without duplicating effort.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Solution Architects, UX Design, QA, Data Engineering, Infrastructure, SRE) to build, test, and deploy integration features.
Stay updated with industry standards in LMS/LXP, LTI, and enterprise SaaS integrations to proactively propose new capabilities that enhance Courseras ecosystem.
Write and review technical documentation for integration components and APIs.
Develop and deploy high-quality code (in Java, Scala, or similar languages) following industry best practices and monitor key service-level indicators (SLIs).

Mentor and collaborate with peers, contributing to technical excellence and a strong engineering culture within the team.

8+ years of experience in backend software engineering roles.
Experience designing and delivering complex, cross-functional integrations or enterprise-scale systems.
Proficient in designing distributed systems, APIs, and writing automated tests.
Expertise in building highly scalable microservices and storage layers using common frameworks, languages, and infrastructure (e.g., Java, Play/Scala, MySQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka).
Experience working with managed cloud services and streaming technologies.
Strong ability to conduct technical research and design long-term solutions to complex business problems.
Commitment to engineering quality, scalability, and building leverage for other teams.
Data-driven approach with a strong motivation to measure success and learn through metrics and experiments.
Proven ability to mentor team members and set a strong engineering culture.

Prior experience working with LTI integrations or enterprise SaaS ecosystem integrations.
Familiarity with LMS/LXP platforms (e.g., Canvas, Blackboard, Moodle, SAP SuccessFactors, Degreed).
Experience building secure and compliant integrations for enterprise customers.
Track record of delivering high-impact results in resource-constrained environments.
